fullText: Mr. Jackman brings his usual high-voltage charisma to the role of a man whose obsession with fly-fishing becomes a metaphor for deeper spiritual yearnings. But Jez Butterworth's poetic drama, for all its lyrical beauty, feels more like a meditation than a fully realized theatrical experience.
